plan.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something you have decided to do
plan.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: His plan is to get a degree in economics and then work abroad for a year.
Do you have any plans for the weekend?
There’s been a change of plan – we’re not going to Ibiza after all.
Your best plan would be to take a taxi.
plan.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a set of actions for achieving something in the future, especially a set of actions that has been considered carefully and in detail
plan.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The chairman outlined the company’s plans for achieving a 10% growth in sales.
There are plans to turn the site of the factory into a park.
plan.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a drawing similar to a map, showing roads, towns, and buildings
plan.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a drawing of a building, room, or machine as it would be seen from above, showing the shape, size, and position of the walls, windows, and doors
plan.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a drawing that shows exactly how something will be arranged
plan.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: I have to organise a seating plan for the dinner.
plan.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: something you have decided to do
plan.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: I have no plans to retire yet.
We had to change our plans at the last minute.
The city authorities have abandoned their plans to host the Super Bowl.
The weather got worse, and we had to cancel our plans to have the party outdoors.
The plan had to be shelved because of lack of money.
The day before my flight, my boss phoned and said there’d been a change of plan.
So what are your immediate plans after graduation?
I think the best plan is to take the train.
plan.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a set of actions for achieving something in the future, especially a set of actions that has been considered carefully and in detail
plan.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: have a plan
Don’t worry – I have a plan.
make plans
Mary has been busy making plans for her wedding.
come up with a plan
The chairman must come up with a plan to get the club back on its feet.
devise/formulate/draw up a plan
He devised a daring plan to steal two million dollars.
The company has already drawn up plans to develop the site.
carry out a plan
The bombers were arrested by the security forces before they could carry out their plans.
keep to/stick to a plan
We’re sticking to our original plan.
abandon/scrap a plan
The plan was scrapped because it was too expensive.
announce/unveil a plan
The government unveiled its plans for a shake-up of the health system.
approve a plan
The plan was approved at a board meeting on 24 December.
reject a plan
The plan was rejected on the grounds that it would cost too much money.
outline a plan
They listened as he outlined his plan.
implement a plan
To implement its plans, the company has entered into a partnership with another software developer.
shelve a plan
The plans will be shelved until an alternative access to the site can be found.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + plan
ambitious
The plan was very ambitious, but it worked.
detailed
The generals drew up detailed plans for the invasion.
cunning/clever/ingenious
They devised a cunning plan to get back their money.
The gang devised a cunning plan to rob the bank.
a five-year/ten-year etc plan
Unesco has a 25-year plan to provide basic education to all.
a grand plan
Marrying the countess was all part of his grand plan.
a master plan
The governors came up with a master plan for saving the school.
a business plan
We’ve developed a business plan to take over the company.
a peace plan
Both sides have agreed to implement the UN peace plan.
a rescue plan
Which rescue plan offers the company the best prospects of survival?
an action plan
My accountant developed a detailed action plan with specific targets.
go according to plan
If everything goes according to plan, we’ll finish in January.
a plan of action
Ministers are discussing a plan of action to deal with the crisis.
a plan of attack
At this stage, you go back to the office and work on a plan of attack.
a plan of campaign
What we need now is a plan of campaign.
plan.translation[0].note_box[2].sections: a set of actions for achieving something in the future, especially a set of actions that has been considered carefully and in detail
Leaders outlined a plan to end the fighting.
plot/conspiracy
a secret plan to do something bad or illegal, made by a group of people
There was a plot to assassinate the president.
a terrorist conspiracy
scheme
an official plan that is intended to help people
The government has introduced a new scheme to help young people find work.
strategy
a carefully designed plan which is intended to achieve a particular purpose over a long period of time
the company’s business strategy
The government’s economic strategy has been criticized by many experts.
We need to develop effective strategies for combating the sale of counterfeit goods.
initiative
a new plan for dealing with a particular problem or for achieving a particular aim
a peace initiative
a major new initiative to tackle street crime
policy
a plan that members of a government, political party, company etc agree on, that states how they intend to deal with a particular subject or problem
the government’s immigration policy
It’s company policy to allow people to work from home.
programme
a series of activities that a government or organization organizes, which aims to achieve something important and will continue for a long time
a five-year programme which will create 2,000 new jobs
federal programs for low-income housing
plan.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to think carefully about something you want to do, and decide how and when you will do it
plan.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: He immediately began planning his escape.
Talks are planned for next week.
The wedding was fine and everything went as planned (=happened the way it had been planned).
Now that you’re pregnant you’ll have to plan ahead.
Maria didn’t plan to kill Fiona. It was an accident.
plan.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The former president is planning a return to politics.
He said he planned to write his essay tonight.
When do you plan on going to Geneva?
plan.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to think about something you are going to make, and decide what it will be like
plan.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Planning a small garden is often difficult.
The system needs to be planned carefully.
plan.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to think carefully about something you want to do in the future, and decide exactly how you will do it
plan.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: We’ve been planning this visit for months — you can’t cancel now.
The whole operation went exactly as planned
A business mustplan ahead (=make plans for a long time in the future), making use of sales and market forecasts.
plan.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: The company is planning a major investment programme.
The company plans to spend $739.9 million on capital improvements next year.
plan.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a set of actions for achieving something in the future, especially one that has been considered carefully and in detail
plan.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The two companies had considered merging some years earlier, but the plan fell through (=the plan was not completed).
If everything goes according to plan (=happens in the way that was arranged), the first stage of the project will be completed by December.
The company’s plans for growth are threatened by their inability to find, keep, and manage key staff.
The President is working on a plan to turn around the economy  (=make the economy successful again).
plan.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: your second plan, which you will use if things do not happen as you expect
plan.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Always have a plan B in case your original choice of career does not work out.
plan.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: something you have decided to do or achieve
plan.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: His plan is to get a degree in economics and then work abroad for a year.
There’s been a change of plan. The meeting’s on Monday instead of this afternoon.
The developer has plans for 625 homes  (=intends to build 625 homes) northwest of the airport.
plan.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: a drawing of a building, room, or machine as it would be seen from above, showing the shape, measurements, position of the walls etc
plan.translation[3].definitions[3].examp: a floor-by-floor plan of the three-storey building.
plan.translation[3].definitions[4].defin: a drawing that shows exactly how something will be arranged
